channel.title: World News - Breaking international news and headlines | Sky News

image.title: World News - Breaking international news and headlines | Sky News

channel.description: The latest international news from Sky, featuring top stories from around the world and breaking news, as it happens.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2021, Sky UK. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Shifa Hospital in Gaza is 'death zone' with mass grave at the door - WHO says
item.description: The Shifa Hospital in the war-ravaged Gaza Strip is a "death zone" with a mass grave at the entrance and a "desperate" situation inside, the World Health Organisation (WHO) has said.

media:description.#text: Picture attached to WHO report on mission to Shifa Hospital in Gaza. Pic: WHO

item.title: 'We already lost - we have 240 people in Gaza': Families of Israeli hostages plead for help from Netanyahu
item.description: Israel's beleaguered prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, has bowed to pressure after a five-day march by families of hostages taken by Hamas and thousands of supporters.

item.title: Troubled Las Vegas Grand Prix hit by lawsuit on behalf of 35,000 fans
item.description: The troubled Las Vegas Grand Prix has been hit by a lawsuit on behalf of 35,000 fans.

media:description.#text: Formula One F1 - Las Vegas Grand Prix - Las Vegas Strip Circuit, Las Vegas, Nevada, U.S - November 18, 2023 Aston Martin's Fernando Alonso in action in front of the sphere during qualifying REUTERS/Mike Blake

item.title: Taylor Swift postpones show in Rio due to 'extreme temperatures' - a day after fan death
item.description: Taylor Swift has postponed a concert in Rio de Janeiro due to "extreme temperatures".

media:description.#text: A Taylor Swift fan shelters from the heat under an umbrella. Pic: AP

item.title: Elite British runner mugged at knifepoint in South Africa
item.description: A former British Army captain has been forced to pull out of a race after he was mugged at knifepoint in South Africa.

item.title: Australian divers 'injured by sonar used by Chinese navy while clearing fishing nets'
item.description: Australian says divers were injured after the Chinese navy used sonar while they were in the water clearing fishing nets.

media:description.#text: Divers were repairing the propeller on the HMAS Toowoomba. Pic: AP

item.title: French senator accused of drugging MP to sexually abuse her
item.description: A French senator is being investigated over allegations he drugged an MP with the intention of sexually abusing her.

media:description.#text: Joel Guerriau. Pic: Paul Brounais/Wikimedia Commons

item.title: President 'doing well' after dog bite on official visit
item.description: Biting the hand of friendship took on a literal meaning during an official visit by Austria's president to Moldova when the country's "first dog" nipped him.

media:description.#text: Moldova's President Maia Sandu and her dog greet Austria's President Alexander Van der Bellen and Slovenia's President Natasa Pirc Musar in Chisinau

item.title: Israel poised for 'second phase' of war - but sympathy is waning | Sean Bell
item.description: Israel's response to Hamas's brutal attacks last month was immediate.

item.title: Hamas claims 'at least 50 killed' in Israeli attack on Gaza school
item.description: The Hamas-run health ministry has claimed at least 50 people have been killed in an Israeli attack on a school in northern Gaza.

media:description.#text: A view over Gaza, as seen from Israel, from earlier this week
